intro: Erigone, commonly known as the common erigon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often emitting a mild, spicy scent. Erigone is a biennial plant, meaning it completes its life cycle over two growing seasons.
